intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Ugh, and there's a village just ahead. Come on!

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: Help! Heeelp! Open the gates! The dead walk the earth! If you've any kindness in you, open the gates! We're from Woodham, up the road! You KNOW us! Please, open the— Gods, no. ...No! They're here! Aaaiiieeeeee!

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: Hmm... The townsfolk of this village are renowned for their hospitality. How could they turn away refugees fearing for their lives?

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Let's worry about saving those lives first. We can ask questions later.

battle.speaker: Elder
battle.line: Shepherds are always welcome here. Please, take this with you.

battle.speaker: Elder
battle.line: Shepherds are always welcome here. Please, take this with you.

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: Listen. There were refugees here and you turned them away. Why?

battle.speaker: Elder
battle.line: We're a peaceful town, sir. We have no weapons, nor any want for them. We survive by barring our gates to those who might bring us harm—friend or foe. Harsh as it may be, I can't have my people dying on account of other folks' problems...

battle.speaker: Villager
battle.line: Oh, thank goodness you've come! Are you here to help us?

battle.speaker: Villager
battle.line: U-understood! If we make it out alive, I'll repay you! I swear!

end.speaker: Villager
end.line: I've not the words to thank you, nor the treasure to pay you, but...here. Take this. I didn't think people like you still existed. I'll...I'll never forget this.

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: Do you suppose the village will continue to bar its gates to refugees?

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: As long as they view the Risen as someone else's problem, then yes.

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: They claim to love peace... Yet the uneasy peace found behind a barricade is nothing I'd want. Peace begins when the fighting is over and the barricades come down. I pray they can see the truth of that before it's too late...
